question:
In context with the FATF (Financial Action Task Force), which of the following countries is / are in its black list as of now?
  1. Pakistan
  2. Sri Lanka
  3. North Korea
  4. Iran
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
FATF was established in the year 1989 and works under OECD (Organization of Economic Cooperation Development) headquartered at Paris, France. It was initiated by the G7 countries. It has in total 36 member countries and 2 regional members (Gulf Corporation Council and European Commission). The 2 countries who have taken observer status are Saudi Arabia and Indonesia. Why in news? Pakistan has announced that they have started to assess about the dent they will get if placed in the black list due to lobbying of India. Pakistan is already paced in the grey list last year. This is done due to failure in keeping check over terror financing and fund activities along with money laundering events. Other countries in the grey list are:
  • Sri Lanka
  • Bostwana
  • Bahamas
  • Cambodia
  • Ethiopia
  • Tunisia
  • Yemen
  • Serbia
  • Syria
  • Ghana
There are two countries placed in the black list: Iran and North Korea. The list display the actions and sanctions imposed over them accordingly which includes reduction in trade.
